title: Alternative to permanent bans
body: Bans are  Necessary to uphold a community standard. I'm not here to argue that point. But to be permabanned is no ones favorite thing. Things happen tempers get high and people troll you into tilt mode. This subject I'm sure has been brought up before nor do I think I'm the first to think of it. But why do we not have a permanent chat ban instead of banning the entire account. To me its unethical to permanently ban an account with an auto program over these things. You can take many examples from many games and I chat ban should be instated before you permanently ban an account. I can understand that chat is banned and now you have someone who feeds over pings and just purposely causes teams to lose to be banned after the perm chat ban and that's it. But it's like a step is missing in this system and that's all I'm saying. I'm sure numerous accounts have been permanently banned because someone had broke rift standards and I'm sure numerous accounts got banned for very little to no  Negativity but others in the game teamed up and banned against him I know this happens. So yes I recently have been given a perma ban on my account for similar reasons. I'm not gunna argue whether or not I should have been banned but rather that an 8 year old account with thousands of dollars and time spent on it with very good behavior besides the last couple months to be perma banned and that's it hands down is a lil too far. There has to be another step riot. Please tell me there is a dev that understands and respects this thought and please tell me that riot ignores these things because of the greater dollar. I have never thought of the company like that but at the same time the way the system works is yes spend all this money and time but at any time if things go south your account and everything in it is just data and now it's gone and that's it no rehabilitation. So my opinions my fix to this is to eliminate perma bans for one(this will never happen but should) instead have very long bans maybe season bans or so. Also incorporate not just chat ban which we know you can do but a perma chat ban which if you can do a temporary one I know you can make it permanent for the account. These fixes in my opinion will change the communities opinions on the ban system in riots favor (again my opinion). What I do not like is a default that's it we dont care about you here is a automated system to show this company I have never thought this of riot. Please some dev read this and hear this. I'm sure I'm not the only one who has stated this. Thank you

You get a 10 game restriction, 25 day restriction, 14 day ban, then a perma. The old adage is "Three strikes and you're out!" not "Three strikes and THEN you're out"; you already get another step. The 14 day ban is your last shot. It's not a horribly hard line to walk. Don't insult players, don't int, don't grief, stay positive. Use the mentality of "If it's not nice don't say it". If there is FRIENDLY trash talk try to keep it civil. If you say something and they don't respond, maybe don't keep saying something. You never need to tell your teammates that "You suck" or "Uninstall" or anything like that. 

I've been playing for nearly 10 years on and off. Several thousand games. Never had to mute myself or mute all. I mute when I need to, use chat when I need/want to. I've trashed talked, gotten a little tilted, etc. Never had a chat ban. You are still able to use the chat for functional and entertainment purposes without crossing the line. If people report you and you WEREN'T harassing them, you're fine. Just learn where that line is and if you aren't sure, err on the side of caution.

B) You are suggesting that after 8 years I have back to back infractions within a fairly short time period? (Say 50 games) Unlikely.
C) If I am that tilted then I won't type at all. I'll mute as needed. If I feel the NEED to critique someone's laning instead of my own I will keep it to one message at maximum. Mostly I'm focusing on my own play though. They don't HAVE to listen to your advice.
D) You are still skipping the 25 game chat restriction and 14 day suspension before getting to permanent ban. View the 14-day ban as your chat restriction. 
E) Again, permanent chat restrictions have been shown to not work in a majority of cases. 
F) You only get less punishments if you are intentionally griefing, feeding, or use hate speech. ALL of those are conscious decisions that are not results  of "accidentally crossing a line". 

If you use hate speech, intentionally ruin games by int'ing or griefing then you deserve to have your punishment escalated. Those behaviors are harder to automatically detect though which is why the process is longer. You already get 3 strikes before your banned. If the point hasn't been made by then, a fourth one (that historically hasn't worked anyways) is unlikely to be your moment where you have an epiphany.

You had a chance to repent after your 10 game chat restriction. Then another one after a 25 restriction. Then another after a 14th day ban. If you didn't get the message by that point, you can only blame yourself. Time for a last minute decision to reform is after a 14 day ban, not after a permanent one. It's called "permanent" for a reason.

This idea is thrown around here multiple times per day by (guess who?) people that have been permanently banned by the system due to their own bad behavior. To reiterate - the system used to hand out infinitely-stacking chat restrictions. It didn't encourage reform and those people resorted to finding other ways to ruin games for people.

At this point, whether you want to hear it or not, Riot has told you in no uncertain terms that they no longer want you as a player or a customer. The benefits of money you'll spend no longer outweigh the cost of keeping you in the game.

This comes up so often that I not only have a response for it saved in a text file full common responses, but that particular response is still the one highlighted.

And here it is.

Riot's punishment system used to hand out stacking chat restrictions, such that consistently toxic players basically had a permanent chat restriction. Unfortunately, it turns out that such players used their few chat opportunities to be toxic, and, when they couldn't be as toxic as they wanted to, they resorted to committing non-chat offenses such as griefing (following someone around and taking their farm, using wall abilities to interfere with their play, etc.) or inting. The purpose of the punishment system is to eliminate rule-breaking, not make it worse. Thus, if a couple chat restrictions don't make any difference in a player's misbehavior, the system ramps up the punishments until the player is permabanned and thus unable to use that account to break any more rules ever again.

According to [Riot Tantram](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/wsObUaFj-if-tyler1?comment=00010001000000000000):

> It really breaks down into two categories.
> 
> 1.) Helping players reform
> 2.) Shielding others from the behavior, at a cost.
> 
> We used to issue chat restrictions that essentially scaled indefinitely.
> 
> We were able to determine that after a certain point the penalty no longer helped with reform. The 10-game and 25-game counts for chat restrictions are based on data that they were both light enough, and felt strict enough to encourage people to understand their behavior is unacceptable in game and change it.
> 
> We also saw that the players in this 'large restriction' category defaulted to gameplay altering means of harassing their team. It caused an increase in feeding and trolling.
> 
> The sample size of this population and time frame is huge. Essentially the time spanning from the introduction of chat restrictions to the introduction of IFS.
> 
> So my question for you is, would you rather have more feeders and less negative chat?
